name: InterContinental Malta

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is not the problem of the hotel , but it is noisy if you stay into the standart room ... There are parties outside , this is the forum for bar and food ...l
reviews.title: A 5 star if you avoid the floor 5-10

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: If you book for the deluxe room , now you are in business ...
reviews.title: Great stay at IC Malta, thanks concierge (Robert)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: 5 star all the way .
reviews.title: upgrade to club level

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Please note the highly professionalism oh Mr Hannes Schnider , customer service ..l who provide us all we needto get a successful holiday
reviews.title: Intercontinental Excellence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Breakfast is 5/5 , Bars 5/5 , food 5/5
reviews.title: Excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: Hotel's facilities are very nice, quite big pool with sea view, garden, and very big and very good gym with sauna, steam room and indoor pool. The only big minus was: conditioner was not working, it was noisy as it was working, but it didn't. I asked at the reception to fix it, and they said: they can NOT turn the conditioner ON, it is not working in the whole hotel (and it was April !!) and we had to suffer from heat all 3 days.
reviews.title: Business stay at Intercontinental

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was very pleasant.
reviews.title: Intercontinantal - Malta

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had the pleasure of staying at the IC Malta during a 3 night midweek break, 30th April until 3rd May 2012.
reviews.title: The staff made our stay even better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Transfer was waiting at the airport even though we were 55 minutes late on arrival. Excellent service from the 1st Minute.
reviews.title: Excellent holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon check-in (as part of ambassador program), were upgraded from club intercontinental to a Terrace Suite, this was 1101 and with the terrace takes up approx 4 rooms worth of space with two balcony's and a double terrace, holding table + 4 chairs two full size loungers and coffee table, with the sun from 10 until 7 every day and overlooking the pool. 30 seconds to pool.
reviews.title: We will come again!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at the Intercontinental to be informed that the hotel was overbooked and that we would have to stay at the Radisson for the first night. By means of recompense Cornelia the Guest Relations Manager (who was excellent throughout our stay) arranged for us to be upgraded to the Club Floor on our return.
reviews.title: Excellent Customer Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location:
reviews.title: Nice surprise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Yes at present the hotel is surrounded by a building site but as long as you manage to obtain a room over the pool and gardens this shouldn't proove to be a problem. The hotel is located right opposite the Bay Street Complex with shops and a few bars / cafes. But if you turn right outside and walk approx 30 metres you hit the steps of Paceville. Bearing in mind we were there in April the bars and clubs were heaving, which was a real surprise and I cant imagine what it will be like in August!
reviews.title: good stay but not so great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms:
reviews.title: Excellent holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Very nice and large with a good sized modern bathroom. Not quite 5* standards but good none the less. Balcony furniture despite being plastic was comfortable.
reviews.title: Super-accommodating and helpful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for five nights at the beginning of May. It is a large hotel which is a little tired in places and could do with updating but this doesn't cause any problems. The hotel restaurants are reasonably well priced for a 5 star hotel but I would avoid the breakfast unless you can get it for free or at a much reduced rate. It is far too busy in the mornings when trying to get your breakfast. My main gripe with this hotel is that our room was far too hot and we were unable to sleep well. I phoned down to reception as our air conditioning was not working and we were told it wasn't switched on as the hotel was still operating on its winter schedule; this was despite it being May and 28 degrees C outside! Not good for a 5 star hotel.
reviews.title: Good hotel but could be great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My first thoughts when we came into the hotel were that it was probably worth a Tripadvisor 4 (what a sad person I am to be thinking in those terms at all!) but in fact it got better and better.
reviews.title: This is the weirdest room only rate I have ever come across

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a stonking deal which meant that for something around 100 Euro per night for 6 nights we had a fabulous large, light, airy room with a balcony with panoramic views, and a smashing bathroom with separate bath and shower. The rate was notionally room only but in fact it also gave us access to the VIP lounge and together with the lavish complimentary breakfast (the full deal with champagne, not just coffee and muffins which is what I had expected) all day soft and hot drinks and fruit, afternoon high tea and early evening full open bar with endless canapés nibbles and tapas, I imagine it would have been perfectly possible not to spend another penny on food and drink! In addition there was the use of two lovely swimming pools (one indoor, one out), a well equipped gym, and a more than decent business centre, with full WiFi access, so short of being paid to stay there I really don’t see how we could have got better value for money.
reviews.title: Diamond Suites on Malta, Intercontinental Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I really don’t want to give the impression that it was all about how much bang for the buck we got, because it seems to me that excellence as much as bargain value was the byword. The design and decor was simple and stunning but most particularly the standard of customer care that was faultless throughout. Quite simply it was unobtrusive and unforced courtesy, efficiency and good old fashioned charm from start to finish (though I found this to be the case amongst the Maltese generally).
reviews.title: couldn't do enough!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We tried two of the hotel restaurants while we were there: the main restaurant was of a very high standard, but the Al Fresco restaurant was completely mind blowing. We eat out a lot (a lot!!!!) but this one goes straight into the unmissable category for variety, flavours, presentation and sheer imagination.
reviews.title: couldn't do enough!

description: InterContinental Malta gives you the best of all worlds: a wonderful waterfront resort complete with private beach and water sports; a central cosmopolitan location close to shopping, entertainment and historic sites; and an array of services appreciated by leisure and business travellers alike. Valletta, Mdina and the Mosta Dome are within easy reach.
